name: Rosemary's
address: 18 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

reviews.text: My visit here was truly amazing, our waitress Melisa was super helpful, very very high level of customer service! She was well aware of our needs and cautious about allergies, I truly enjoyed our brunch here because of her! So the venue is excellent! Burger was great! Melissa was awesome!

The dishes are nicely executed right on the spot. Some of them are creative. The service is very very good. They change your napkins during your restroom breaks, at a brunch place. It is one of a kind. A nice Chelsea brunch spot on a sunny weekend morning.

Best go to stop with the wife. Love their brunch menu, if youâ€™re a fan of brunch this is one of spots to be at. Although it can get a bit over packed, itâ€™s best to always have a reservation unless youâ€™re stopping by during an early weekday. Theyâ€™re very attentive while youâ€™re waiting for a table as well

As good as it gets.

This is one of my favorite places to get food inthe area. The pasta is unique and delicious. The wine list is good and reasonably priced.
I have been here multiple times and every time the food is perfect.
The portion sizes are good.

They have glutenfree pasta

Muy buen ambiente y atenciÃ³n
Excelente carta de vinos

Great food and great service
Pet friendly
We had a great time. Waiter was awesome. Made sure we made felt taken care of. Itâ€™s always scary to go out to eat with kids but the atmosphere and service was all very accommodating!
Ordered salads and NAPOLETANO - overly salted.
Very cozy, try the foccacia as a starter! Big, easy to share the 6 parts between the two of you.

Perfect place to spend a sunny Sunday afternoon. All dishes were solid and service was great. Especially liked the whipped truffle ricotta spread on the fresh focaccia as well as Cavatelli with wild mushrooms.
Donâ€™t expect too much food, but the service was fine

Rosemaryâ€™s is a staple NYC establishment. Itâ€™s consistent and reliable. The food is good and fresh. The one thing i will say is that they jam you in there like a can of sardines which can be at times unpleasant and make conversations hard to hear.

the food is good so i continue to return :)
Stopped in for coffee and dessert. Delicioso!
A wonderful neighborhood eatery with a casual vibe. The food was as expected, very good.
Muy ruidoso, pero excelente lugar.
Food was okay, service was terrible.

We had an early dinner on Saturday. Unfortunately, the service was quite slow â€” our starters took a while to arrive, and the main courses came much later.

The starters were excellent and highly recommended, but the mains were disappointing. There were three of us, and none of us could finish (or really enjoy) our main dishes.

The restaurant was also very noisy, which made it hard to have a conversation. The staff were friendly but extremely busy, so it often took a long time to get our serverâ€™s attention.

Overall, a mixed experience â€” great starters, but the mains and service really fell short.

I had lunch here today and Kevin was the person who took care of my table, the service was excellent and the atmosphere is very nice, first time here for me but I will come back because I had a very good time

food was very good. however, when ordering, I asked to hold on to a menu because we wanted to order more food - the waiter instead took the menus and told us we couldn't keep them because they've been getting dirty (?) and that if we wanted more the menus would be located at the host stand...so we didn't order more food.
Lively and popular place. Typical Italian dishes. The 2 pastas we had were very salty. Sent 1 back and said no salt but came back very salty again. Maybe the preference in this region.
Lovely looking place with very poor food, what seemed and tasted like leftover vegetables, odd smelling mushrooms and weak coffee.
Weak food, weak coffee

Walked in for an early dinner around 4:45. The restaurant was fairly empty so I was surprised when we were told we could be seated but that we needed to leave by 6 because of upcoming reservations. We should have left at that point. We were seated and ordered drinks, focaccia, and pasta. As we were eating at no point was more than 1/3 of the restaurant full. Just made me feel anxious the whole time we were eating that weâ€™d stay longer than 6 and then what would have happened? Good was okay, not great. Our sever changed half way through our meal which was okay but odd. Overall, for the price of the food and drinks, Iâ€™d go somewhere else next time.
Le lieu est sympa avec la terrasse mais la nourriture nâ€™Ã©tait las au rdv pour moi. Correct mais sans plus.
Interesting take on traditional Italian food.

wow, what a great spot... the fiance and I were visiting with our friends and needed a place to stop in for a quick drink and bite before a show. food was great, and service was great to! the bartender was nice and drinks were fast. and thank you chris for the chat and recommendations while we enjoy the city!
Been here a few times, friendly and attentive service each time. I had the carbonara which was bursting with flavor and perfect al dente noodlesâ€¦ Iâ€™m still thinking about it to this day.
Our waiter Jason was great. Was very patient and informative! Also helped me get my flowers from coat check. Lovely experience would love to go back soon!

This place is amazing! Everything on the menu looks incredible. We started with the crispy artichoke, so good like potato chips outside, Sicilian salad and then the orichette. our server Jackie was excellent, her suggestions were right on point-- every dish was spot on. She went above and beyond, so friendly and courteous, which I always appreciate.we went to see the garden upstairs where all the salad ingredients are grown. Talk about farm to table! We will definitely come back n try other things. We sat outside n saw Quentin Tarantino pass by! I pointed at him â€ğŸ¤¦ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸

Went here for my birthday and overall the food was good but the service left me disappointed. When we first arrived for our 7pm reservation, we were asked to wait by the bar for our table to be ready, which was perfectly fine. We enjoyed dinner and had just gotten the drinks we ordered for dessert when we were asked to take our drinks back to the bar to finish because they needed the table. So at 8:30 on the dot, we were removed from our table and stood at the bar to finish our drinks. I know that most reservations include a 90min disclaimer but I have genuinely never had this happen to me before. I understand the restaurant needs to turn tables but I felt it was a bit extreme to remove us at exactly 90mins after our reservation and when we had just received our last drinks. It felt like we were no longer welcome and will not be coming back.
They have a great lunch special that you get to pick any salad and pasta and they are not stingy with the serving size! Food was great and service was quick and attentive. Canâ€™t wait to return!
Great food and excellent service from Cristian B.

Delicious!!

If you're looking for some tasty pasta in a nice but still casual setting this is for you!

I got the Chitarra Alla Carbonara and it was bursting with flavor. It tasted so fresh and salty and perfect I'd get it every time!
Nice Italian restaurant, good food choices, tasty food.  Family enjoyed it here.
Great location and friendly personnel! The food was a little bland though, which is quite disappointing. It is also way too noisy inside. Wouldnâ€™t come back.
Had a nice carbonara. The focaccia was a large portion, but no oil or butter to enjoy it with, it was a bit dry
Casual vibe but still a really nice atmosphere.  The food is great and the service was awesome.
Meilleur restaurant de NY

Went w a couple friends for dinner on a Friday night in December. The interior decor was the perfect amount of festive. Lots of little lights and greenery. The place was poppin w large groups of women celebrating. Given how many people were in a large space, the acoustics were surprisingly great. We could hear each other and not yell across the table.

The service was absolutely excellent. We ordered a drink at the wine bar when our server came over to seat us. They had the drinks promptly delivered to our table and we didnâ€™t even have to say anything. Felt really nice to be so taken care of!

I got the rigatoni and it just wasnâ€™t great. The chicken Milanese was on the thicker side. The ricotta and eggplant were excellent.

I would absolutely go back though. Great holiday vibes and the staff works so hard!

Updates - took a f friend here over Labor Day weekend and the food was absolutely incredible. The steak, potatoes, whipped ricotta on focaccia w truffles and honey, absolutely mind blowing. Already planning my next visit!
Ok

My three friends and I traveled to New York for a much awaited trip and unfortunately Rosemarys cast an awful shadow on our time in New York. From the moment we entered, the two hostesses on the door were very standoffish and rude. One hostess in a very rude and disrespectful tone said that my friend had her name spelled incorrectly on the booking - this is simply my friends Irish name. As we were sat down, there was a very strong hostile vibe coming from the servers. Putting this aside, we decided to focus on enjoying our meal and drinks. However, when we ordered our drinks, and asked for ID one of my friends was told her ID wasnâ€™t valid. Given we traveled transatlantic, we did not carry our physical passport books out with us, just our identity cards from our respective countries. Whilst two of our cards were accepted, my other friends was not. Kevin our server, was kind enough to check with his manager if this was valid. However, the manager came to our table with honestly the most rudest and patronising explanation. Given the ID can be used as a valid method of travel, we queried this but where then very rudely mansplained the concept of a passport. As three people who have all worked in the hospitality and service industry, we know the stress and intensity of restaurant work but the way we were spoken to was unacceptable. As a quiet, non rowdy group of young woman we were extremely embarrassed and upset in how we were spoken to. Two of us got our drinks, and when we all got our food, we felt that the hostess was circling our table and it was all around uncomfortable. A gorgeous restaurant with decent food, but the staff need some serious thinking about how they approach and communicate with guests - when you give respect you get respect. We understand that the ID requirement is a policy but given this, it should be specified in the booking: All around upsetting.
Great atmosphere, amazinggg food and drinks fairly prices

Great place! Our table love the octopus and burrata appetizers. Orrechiette and tagliatelle dishes were very tasty pasta dishes. Steak and chicken are good choices too! Has some interesting â€œverdureâ€ or vegetables section that made our vegetarian friends thrilled
Did not deliver my food and I waited a hour
What a shame. The waitress of the bar treated us terrible, very bad mood and we decided to leave. Nice place just in case
Stopped by on a whim for lunch and everything was delightful. Super fresh and our server was lovely!
En servicio fatal, me ha faltado al respeto no me ha atendido como debÃ­a.
Ristorante italiano con ottimo servizio, cibo discreto e un terrazzo tipo rooftop super accogliente.
We went there for a work dinner and it was a great experience. We got a set menu and everything was curated professionally. Cool atmosphere and good food!

To see a mouse gallivanting on the dining room floor two hours after I finished dining at this restaurant is the most gag worthy thing I ever experienced in my life, just thinking about the possibility of rodent chewing through the food at night and the possibility of my food being most likely contaminated before I ate it is the worst feeling in the world. Rats and rodents and insects are a no go in the dining industry. Yâ€™all should be ashamed.

A fun atmosphere but hit or miss food. The carbonara here is the Roman version, entailing a strong pepper flavor and aroma. I found it to be over empowering. The calamari was our favorite. The meatballs are good, and so is the gem lettuce salad. The mussels were great but the bread was unappealing.

The food is fresh and the ambience is very relaxed and vibrant! I came here with friends for brunch and I enjoyed my scrambled eggs and arugula salad along with the rosemary water. We shared the olive oil cake and it was delicious too

Loved the ambiance. Food and service was great. The line moved quickly. Co-ed bathrooms were odd but neat. Awkward washing my hands next to a strange woman in a public bathroom. But what a cool place. Legit Carbonara was delish!

A nice place for a quick bite. The drinks are not great. They dont have top shelf liquor, but they're open about it. Maybe they could get on that. Overall, it was a good experience.

Edited to respond:
Thank you. I'll make sure to ask my server to double-check with the bartender next time.  He may have been new, understandable that he didn't know your full liquor selection. I'd like to stress that he was nice, though.
Always a favourite stop in the city.  Love the rotating menu.  Food is so fresh and great quality. The restaurant is gorgeous as well. One of the best places for a meal of any occasion.

I was not really feeling the menu but after talking with the waitress she recommended what I should order instead and the pasta was amazing!!!

Limoncello was solid as well.  The restaurant looking awesome is just the cherry on top ğŸ™‚ had a nice time here.

Btw I think it's called Rosemary's because it seems like they put rosemary I'm most of the food lol

The food was quite good!

Unfortunately it was raining that day so we didnâ€™t get to see the top floor with their rooftop but the ground floor is nicely decorated. Very cute interior.

The food was very flavorful and the waiters were very attentive. Ambiance made the experience even more special. I love the layout of the restaurant and the decor gives you the feeling of being in Europe

I ended up at Rosemaryâ€™s after my original destination didnâ€™t have any open seats. It was fate! I sat by myself and was sat immediately. The restaurant was full otherwise. I started with an Angelâ€™s Envy on the rocks and a baby gem Ceasar salad. Then, I did the lunch Frix Fixe. I had the Chitarra Alla Carbonara with a glass of Bianco. To finish, I had the Tiramisu. Everything was delicious and the service was great. If I ever find myself in NY again, Iâ€™ll be back!

A one and done for me. Walked in for dinner (a huge mistake on my part) and was immediately informed I had to give the table back in 1.5 hrs. Very welcoming. Well while i waited forever to be attended to within my 1.5hrs i found  a nasty bug hiding out in my napkin. The food was lacking in flavor. Believe the Yelp reviews. The salad was not fresh at all and tasteless. The entree was a waste of time severely lacking in seasoning.  Management needs to realize that service is subpar at this establishment. You had all these workers milling around this horribly noisy place dragging chairs and slamming dishes on the table, yet they all manage not to see you trying to get their attention smh. Also, please get rid of this sheisty, sneaky way of shoving those payment machines in our faces with tips starting from 20% on sometimes the total, not the subtotal as it should be. It's tacky and shows less than honest business practices. These machines have been used all over Europe since the 2000s but trust Americans to abuse the purpose of a thing. Now that the restaurants got their greasy hands on it, they use it as a tactic to extort tips out of patrons. I will gladly tip for even half decent service, but for subpar service combined with tasteless unseasoned food, it leaves a bad taste.

There are certain restaurants that give an AWKWARD and ODD first impression, this is that place! And I am very confident in my review and assessment of my own experience.

The first oddity was that my party has a server that greeted us, placed our order then she said she was done for the night. But she was not, an hour later she was still serving , just not our table but literally the table two tables over. ODD!

The food is fine, nothing to write home about. I did not think the dishes ordered were anymore impressive than any other Italian restaurant of its calibar.

It was evident that my party of 2 had severely overstayed our time limit, after 45 minutes of receiving our dinner, almost immediately various staff kept coming over asking are we done? Can we box this up for you? Do you need anything else? About 6 different staff not including our new server kept coming to the table which I now understand, was to encourage us to GET OUT!

Finally, a manager came over and (politely) asked could we move to the bar as they had other reservations and needed the table. AWKWARD!

A rationale person can deduce with the number of staff that kept coming to the table and finally a manager, coming over, clearly they all were talking about us, agitated, and wanted us to leave. And we immediately left thereafter.

Friday night, west village, I get it. But this is not the place for date night or conversation.

I highly encourage you to eat your food within a one hour period or less and immediately leave.

I am very confident in my review and my experience. I have no qualms if someone has concerns with my review.
Very warm vibes. We got the Rigatoni Alla Arrabiatta, chopped salad Siciliana, and olive oil cake. Recommend all of them.
We had a fantastic meal and experience. The place is super cute and service is friendly and polite. Food options are plenty and interesting. We shared apps, the food was delish.

I saved this place a while ago and finally had the chance to try it today. The prices are on the higher end. The food quality was quite decent; I enjoyed both pasta dishes. The whipped burrata was good, but I found the bread too hard to bite into. However, the sauce paired with the tomato was excellent, and the honey added a nice touch of sweetness. I would consider returning, but it might not be my first choice.

We had an amazing experience at this restaurant! The atmosphere was great, the food was delicious, and the service was outstanding. Our bartender, Ali, went above and beyond to make our evening special. Friendly, attentive, and incredibly skilledâ€”Ali made the best drinks and added such a great vibe to our visit. Highly recommend!

Great food in a beautiful restaurant. The grilled octopus and the Caprese Focaccia were delicious. The rigatoni allabiratta was perfectly Al dente and sooo tasty. The risotto Milanese was absolutely delicious and I highly recommend. Tiramisu and chocolate tart with olive oil drizzled on top is also a must try. Looking forward to going back. Also the space its self is beautiful and has an incredible vibe to it.

This was my second time visiting Rosemary. I was one of the few people there. The hostess was kind, and the service was actually good. I ordered the â€˜Steak Tagliataâ€™ and â€˜Rosemary Potatoes.â€™ The steak was just okay, and the sauce had anchovies in it, which I didnâ€™t enjoy that much. Iâ€™m a steak lover but something was off. The potatoes were good. I would definitely go back, but Iâ€™d order something else.

We went right before Christmas because we wanted somewhere festive and cozy. It did not disappoint. All the food was super delicious but the orechiette was out of this world. The cheesy foccacia was also so good. Service was excellent, I think our server was Myra and she was really helpful and made great recommendations. Price was pretty reasonable too for such a nice place. Would definitely go again.

It was a truly wonderful experience. My friend and I enjoyed a market salad first, and we believe that to truly judge the quality of a restaurant, their salad is the critical place to start, and they nailed it. The greens were so flavorful and fresh they could have been served without dressing but the light vinaigrette was just perfectly balanced and elevated what was already a delicious dish.

Then there was the sandwich. I have worked in delis, and have scoured New Yorks sandwich scene and was shocked to find that the Italiano Panino at Rosemaryâ€™s may be in my top 3â€¦ and itâ€™s a full service restaurant!!!

We're so happy we stopped in Rosemary's, what a cool spot! OK, first, all we had was some vino and a snack of their delicious olives w/ orange zest and prosciutto. But the vibe of the cool farmhouse-chic open space, very nice staff and great-looking menu is gonna bring us back again soon.  Go!

Had a solo dinner here on Sunday.

The bread given to my table was a little dry but I had the birds helping me, they kept flying over to steal my bread. The waiter gave me more bread after which is when I realized the first bread given were much drier.
I ordered the olives, the eggplant appetizer and an aperol spritz.
â€¢ The marinated olives is embedded in a mixture of cumin and olive oil. Amazing flavors, great with the table bread!
â€¢ Eggplant was flavorful, with pungent tomatoes and soft focaccia.
â€¢ Aperol Spritz was perfect to taste!

Rosemary's is a wonderful dining spot that truly exceeded our expectations. From the moment we walked in, we were welcomed with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The rustic decor and lush greenery create a cozy and delightful setting that immediately puts you at ease.

The service was impeccable â€“ friendly, attentive, and very knowledgeable about the menu. We started with the beet and goat cheese salad, which was fresh, vibrant, and beautifully presented. The fennel dish was another standout, with a perfect balance of flavors and textures. The smoked salmon with focaccia was simply delightful, with the salmon being fresh and the focaccia crisp and flavorful. The omelet was perfectly cooked and came with a side of fresh arugula, which added a nice, light touch to the meal.

Although we didn't have any alcohol, the extensive selection of wines and cocktails on the menu looked impressive. Each dish was a testament to the farm-to-table approach that Rosemary's prides itself on, with high-quality, fresh ingredients shining through in every bite.

Overall, our dining experience at Rosemary's was exceptional. We left thoroughly satisfied and eager to return for another delightful meal. Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy top-tier cuisine in a charming and comfortable setting!

This place is HUGE! I came for brunch date and immediately noticed the large dining tables.

The staff here is absolutely lovely. Our server had great recommendations for us. Apparently a lot of their herbs and produce come from their rooftop garden!

All of our food was super tasty and fresh. My favorite was the whipped burrata!

Rosemaryâ€™s was fantastic. The atmosphere was so warm and inviting (especially around Christmas time). We missed our reservation grace period by 2 minutes due to some subway issues so we had to wait some extra time but they got us seated quickly.
We started with the cacio e Pepe polenta and it was to die for, the whipped burrata was fantastic too, no notes. We also got a Caesar salad which I loved but it does come with whole anchovies on it and my friends were not a fan so I ate them all haha.
We each got a different pasta dish including the shrimp linguine, bolognese, carbonara, and Orecchiette. All of the pasta dishes were ahhhmazing. If you like garlic, the linguine is for you. If you like a hearty meat sauce, get that bolognese. The carbonara was creamy and perfectly salty. And the orecchiette was chefs kiss ğŸ‘ŒğŸ¼
All in all we had a great experience! Thank you!!

Definitely a 5 star restaurant! Service & food were great. The atmosphere was beautiful, clean and big enough to have a good amount of space between tables. Apparently I was told that they grow their own herbs on the rooftop. Itâ€™s a wonderful place to dine- cozy, could be romantic or even family friendly. I absolutely love the place and will be back.

Overall, this place was perfectly okay. Super small portions at very high prices. Service was okay (although I admit we were a very high maintenance group with several requests).

The atmosphere is very beautiful, but I would recommend looking deeper in the village for a more authentic feel.

Rosemary's in Greenwich Village is a popular Italian restaurant praised for its fresh all. The pastas they served here tasted delicious that I wanted to eat more. The portion of the food is just right. Their Chocolate Torta is a must order if you ever come here. Food was fresh. The atmosphere feels lively, and good service.  We ordered Calamari Fritti, Chitarra Alla Carbonara, Bolognese pasta, and chocolate Torta. I have to say that I'm a big pasta lover and this place did not disappoint at order if you go. The vibes inside felt cozy with Christmas music playing. There's also a tree inside where people can take pictures. It's a great spot for casual dining and enjoying the neighborhood vibe here. I'll definitely come back again for their delicious pasta.

came here for an early brunch and it was such a good experience â€” not too crowded yet & great ambiance. thereâ€™s a lot of seating, and i felt like i actually got some nutrients too  (ordered the con funghi) which doesnâ€™t always happen eating out lol. the food wasnâ€™t like amazing (the bread was kinda really burnt) but would be excited to try more of the menu

We dine at Rosemaryâ€™s every Thanksgiving Eve because the twinkling holiday decor sets the mood as we kick off the holiday season. Our server was a little bit clumsy this year, but nothing major to complain about. The food has been consistently tasty.

We had the steak for the first time this visit. It was tender and of a high quality considering itâ€™s a fairly affordable price for a steak. The rigatoni alla arrabbiata was simple and spicy. A little too al dente for my preference. Nevertheless, I was still pleased with it.

I look forward to returning next thanksgiving eve!

Italian country meets busy NYC  vibes. Spacious and high ceiling.

Mark, the hostess, made us feel so welcome. Unfortunately our server was mainly transactional (ready for drink? Ready for order? Ready for dessert? Ready for bill? Etc.)

The Rosemaryâ€™s Prosecco was refreshing and sweet. The meatballs were one of the best weâ€™ve had in NYC - moist and soft, intense flavors from the beef, pork and prosciutto. Another unfortunate miss â€¦ the meat balls were not served hot, almost as if from leftover at another table.

The linguine was also not well presented - just a blob of pasta tossed with small shrimps. No garnish. A bit flavorless except the garlic.

The special salad with kales, pumpkins, quinoa was exceptional. A true autumn salad. The presentation again not visual pleasing.

Other dishes we had were good. We had a very good time. Will definitely come back to visit the garden upstairs.

The prosciutto focaccia was very good! We got the pesto gemelli, the chitarra carbonara, and the orechiette. All three dishes were way too salty to be enjoyed. The orechiette particularly was a bit unedible, very overwhelming. The bombolini dessert was good but the nutella cream did not really add anything to it. Sadly wonâ€™t be coming back, despite the nice servers and cozy interior.
